title: Star Wars
creator_credit: George Lucas, Gary Kurtz, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
brief_description: A Long time ago in a galaxy far far away, George Lucas’s space adventure captured the hearts and imaginations of film lovers of all ages from the moment these words scrolled across the screen. The Empire’s evil Death Star must be destroyed. The heroes, Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, Han Solo and a pair of droids named R2-D2 and C-3PO, as part of the Rebel Alliance, must pit their strength against the might of the Empire and the evil Jedi, Darth Vader. With the help of an old Jedi Knight, Obi-Wan Kenobi, they battle the forces of darkness and triumph. The special effects and famous “Star wars” theme music has ensured that this film takes its place in cinema history. Includes a ten minute interview between George Lucas and Leonard Maltin.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

constellations_other.name: Eighties hunks
constellations_other.description: Thor’s hero costume from Thor: Love and Thunder was inspired by classic comics of the 80s. Gone are the military greys, replaced with bright golds and bold colours. Let’s take a look at the lineage of 80s action heroes to which this version of Thor belongs.
